meanings.definition: To make a deep, hoarse sound like a frog or raven.
meanings.sent1: The frog began to croak loudly by the pond.
meanings.sent2: I heard the raven croak in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The frog decided to croak a bedtime story to the tadpoles.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden floorboards seemed to croak with every step.
meanings.sent5: The croak of the frog echoed through the night, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The old tree will croak soon, but new saplings will grow.
meanings.sent2: He believed that when you croak, you become a star in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The ancient computer finally decided to croak after years of service.
meanings.sent4: The engine in the car seemed to croak its last breath before stopping.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the brave knight had to croak in order to save the kingdom.

meanings.definition: A deep, hoarse sound made by a frog or raven.
meanings.sent1: The eerie croak of the raven sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: The peaceful night was filled with the soothing croak of frogs.
meanings.sent3: The croak of the frog interrupted the quiet of the garden party.
meanings.sent4: The croak of the raven seemed to carry a message from the beyond.
meanings.sent5: The loud croak of the frog was a familiar sound in the wetlands.
